name: Invidyo
0:
”Alexa, show me the baby room”
”Alexa, what’s the temperature of kitchen”
”Alexa, turn off baby room camera”
skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
Invidyo cameras are designed to help you look after your home and family – even when you’re away. They have also built-in temperature sensor. Now you can control your Invidyo camera by speaking to your Echo devices using the Alexa Voice Remote.

To get started, select the 'Enable Skill' button to link your Invidyo account and discover your Invidyo cameras. For further assistance, please refer to http://tinyurl.com/alexa-smart-home.

After linking your Invidyo account and discovering your Invidyo cameras in your Alexa account, you can start streaming live video to your Echo Show or Fire TV. To see your Invidyo camera feed on the device, just say commands* like:
"Alexa, show the baby room camera"
"Alexa, show the feed from the kitchen camera"

To stop your Invidyo camera from streaming video, you can say:
"Alexa, hide the kids room camera"

To learn the temperature, you can say:
"Alexa, what is the temperature of baby room"

To turn off your camera, you can say:
"Alexa, turn off the kids room camera"

To turn on your camera, you can say:
"Alexa, turn on the kids room camera"

When using this Skill, you need to specify the name of the desired camera. The name is equivalent to the location of where the camera was installed and can be found and configured in the Invidyo app. You can also add Invidyo cameras to new or existing groups in the Alexa app (http://tinyurl.com/alexa-smart-home-groups).
